title: Buck Satan and the 666 Shooters
text:
Buck Satan and the 666 Shooters is an American <a href="alternative%20country">alternative country</a> band, formed by <a href="Ministry%20%28band%29">Ministry</a> frontman <a href="Al%20Jourgensen">Al Jourgensen</a>, who uses the pseudonym Buck Satan. The initial lineup also featured <a href="Rick%20Nielsen">Rick Nielsen</a> of <a href="Cheap%20Trick">Cheap Trick</a> and ex-Ministry members <a href="Tony%20Campos">Tony Campos</a> and <a href="Mike%20Scaccia">Mike Scaccia</a>.
The band was formed in 2006 after the death of the country singer <a href="Buck%20Owens">Buck Owens</a>, who inspired Jourgensen to start the project. Jourgensen also referred to band's musical style as "<a href="heavy%20metal%20music">heavy</a> <a href="Western%20music%20%28North%20America%29">western</a>" and "<a href="cowpunk">country</a>-<a href="hardcore%20punk">core</a>".
The band's only studio album, "<a href="Bikers%20Welcome%20Ladies%20Drink%20Free">Bikers Welcome Ladies Drink Free</a>", was released on January 17, 2012, via <a href="13th%20Planet%20Records">13th Planet</a>. It received mixed reviews from critics.
The band's guitarist, Mike Scaccia, died on December 23, 2012, due to a heart attack while performing onstage with <a href="Rigor%20Mortis%20%28band%29">Rigor Mortis</a>.
